summary: Professional crypto swing trading dashboard with cyberpunk/futuristic visual design featuring neon accents on dark backgrounds, real-time price tracking for 20-30 top cryptocurrencies, technical indicators (RSI, MACD, Moving Averages, Bollinger Bands), swing trading signals, multi-timeframe chart analysis, candlestick pattern recognition, support/resistance detection, market sentiment dashboard, dark mode with neon cyberpunk styling, mobile-responsive design, Internet Identity authentication, CoinGecko API integration, Motoko backend, React + TypeScript frontend. Portfolio tracker and trading journal features removed.
architectural_notes: React + TypeScript frontend with Tailwind CSS for styling
Motoko backend for storing user data and preferences
CoinGecko API integration for real-time cryptocurrency price data
Internet Identity for secure user authentication
30-60 second refresh intervals for real-time price updates
Mobile-responsive design for all screen sizes
In-app toast/banner notifications for real-time trade alerts
Dedicated heatmap page with interactive grid visualization
Cyberpunk UI theme with neon accents (electric blue, vibrant purple, neon green) on deep black backgrounds
known_issues: CoinGecko API rate limiting causing dashboard data load failures
Intermittent 'Failed to load cryptocurrency data' errors on initial page load
Charts occasionally display 'No chart data available' instead of rendering properly

existing_features.title: Implement real-time price tracking for 20-30 top cryptocurrencies using CoinGecko API with 30-60 second refresh intervals. Display current price, 24h change percentage, 24h volume, and market cap for each cryptocurrency.

Calculate and display technical indicators for each tracked cryptocurrency: RSI (Relative Strength Index), MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence), Moving Averages (SMA and EMA), and Bollinger Bands. Use historical price data from CoinGecko API to compute these indicators.

Generate swing trading signals based on standard technical analysis: RSI oversold/overbought zones (buy when RSI < 30, sell when RSI > 70), MACD crossovers (buy on bullish crossover, sell on bearish crossover), and support/resistance level breaks. Display clear buy/sell zones with visual indicators.

Build a portfolio tracker where users can manually enter their trades (cryptocurrency, buy price, quantity, date). Calculate and display current portfolio value, total P&L (profit/loss), individual position P&L, and percentage gains/losses. Store portfolio data in Motoko backend per authenticated user.

Implement a customizable watchlist feature where users can add or remove cryptocurrencies from their personal watchlist. Store watchlist preferences per user in Motoko backend. Display watchlist prominently on dashboard with quick access to tracked coins.

Provide multi-timeframe chart analysis with 1-hour, 4-hour, and daily candlestick charts for each cryptocurrency. Allow users to switch between timeframes seamlessly. Fetch appropriate historical data from CoinGecko API for each timeframe.

Implement candlestick pattern recognition to identify common patterns (e.g., hammer, doji, engulfing patterns, morning/evening star). Highlight detected patterns on charts with labels and descriptions to assist swing trading decisions.

Detect and display support and resistance levels for each cryptocurrency based on historical price action. Mark these levels clearly on charts with horizontal lines. Update levels dynamically as new price data arrives.

Create a market sentiment dashboard aggregating key sentiment indicators: fear/greed index representation, trending cryptocurrencies, top gainers/losers over 24h, and overall market trend (bullish/bearish/neutral). Use CoinGecko API data to derive sentiment metrics.

Build a trading journal feature where users can log their trades with details: entry/exit prices, trade rationale, outcome, and personal notes. Store journal entries per user in Motoko backend. Provide a searchable, filterable view of past trades to review trading performance and strategy.

Implement dark mode and light mode themes with perfect visibility and readability in both modes. Use Tailwind CSS for theming. Provide a theme toggle in the UI. Persist theme preference per user in Motoko backend.

Ensure the entire dashboard is mobile-responsive with layouts that adapt gracefully to different screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile). Use Tailwind CSS responsive utilities. Prioritize usability on smaller screens for key features like watchlist, portfolio, and trading signals.

Integrate Internet Identity authentication for secure user login and session management. Require authentication to access portfolio, watchlist, trading journal, and theme preferences. Store user-specific data in Motoko backend keyed by Internet Identity principal.

Design a clean, professional UI with Tailwind CSS that conveys authority and trustworthiness for financial data. Use a cohesive color scheme that avoids clichÃ© blue/purple gradients, clear typography hierarchy, intuitive navigation, and data-dense layouts without clutter. Ensure consistent spacing, alignment, and component styling across all views.

Implement in-app toast/banner notifications that trigger when swing trading signals are generated (RSI oversold/overbought zones, MACD crossovers, support/resistance breaks). Display the notification with cryptocurrency name, signal type (buy/sell), reason, and timestamp. Notifications should appear when the dashboard is open and auto-dismiss after 5-7 seconds with option to dismiss manually.

Create a dedicated Alert History page/view accessible from main navigation that displays all triggered trade alerts for the authenticated user. Show alert timestamp, cryptocurrency, signal type (buy/sell/hold), trigger reason (e.g., 'RSI below 30', 'Bullish MACD crossover', 'Price broke resistance at $50,000'), and confidence level. Include filters by cryptocurrency and signal type. Store alert history per user in Motoko backend with timestamp, crypto ID, signal data, and trigger reason.

Create a new dedicated Market Heatmap page/view accessible from main navigation. Display all 20-30 tracked cryptocurrencies as a visual grid of blocks where block size represents market cap (larger blocks for larger cap coins) and color intensity represents 24-hour price change (green shades for gains, red shades for losses). Clicking a block navigates to that cryptocurrency's detail page. Use a responsive grid layout that adapts to screen size.

Enhance mobile-first responsive design across all new features (alert history page, market heatmap, Fibonacci overlays). Ensure heatmap grid adapts to mobile screens with smaller blocks that remain readable and tappable. Optimize alert history table/list for mobile with card-based layout instead of table on small screens. Ensure toggle controls for heatmap layers are touch-friendly and stack vertically on mobile. Test all interactions on mobile devices to ensure smooth performance and usability.

Implement user-friendly retry buttons in the CryptoTable component and other data-fetching components that display 'Failed to load cryptocurrency data' errors. Add a prominent 'Retry' button centered in the error state UI that triggers a manual refetch of the failed query. Style the button consistently with the existing UI design.

Add exponential backoff retry logic to the useCryptoPrices hook to handle CoinGecko API rate limiting. Configure React Query's retry option with exponential backoff (retryDelay: attempt => Math.min(1000 * 2 ** attempt, 30000)) and set retry count to 3 attempts before showing the error state.

Implement request batching in the coingecko.ts service to fetch cryptocurrency data for multiple coins in a single API call instead of individual requests. Modify fetchCryptoPrices to use CoinGecko's batch endpoint that accepts comma-separated coin IDs (e.g., /coins/markets?vs_currency=usd&ids=bitcoin,ethereum,cardano) to reduce total API call volume.

Add a TimeframeSelector component to the Dashboard page header, positioned prominently between the page title and the CryptoTable. The selector should control the default timeframe for chart previews and data displays across the dashboard. Add a new state variable in Dashboard.tsx to manage the selected timeframe (1H, 4H, Daily) and pass it as a prop to relevant child components that display chart data or technical indicators.

Create a new AI trade recommendation system in the CryptoDetail page that analyzes all available technical data (active signals from useTradingSignals, support/resistance levels from useChartData, detected patterns from useChartData, RSI/MACD/MA/BB values from useTechnicalIndicators) and generates actionable trade recommendations. Display recommendations in a new 'AI Trade Analysis' card component positioned prominently on the CryptoDetail page below the chart section.

Implement the recommendation generation logic in a new utility file frontend/src/utils/aiTradeRecommendations.ts. Create a generateTradeRecommendation function that accepts technical data (signals, indicators, patterns, support/resistance) and returns a structured recommendation object containing: entry point price with reasoning, three take-profit targets (conservative 5-8%, moderate 10-15%, aggressive 20-30% from entry), stop-loss price (positioned below nearest support or 3-5% below entry), overall confidence score (0-100 based on signal strength and indicator alignment), risk level (low/medium/high based on volatility and signal clarity), and detailed reasoning text explaining the recommendation logic.

Display the AI-generated trade recommendation in the 'AI Trade Analysis' card component with a clear visual hierarchy. Show entry point price prominently at the top with an icon and color coding (green for buy entry, red for sell/short entry). Display the three take-profit targets in a horizontal row with badges labeled 'Conservative', 'Moderate', 'Aggressive' showing both price and percentage gain. Show stop-loss price with a warning icon. Display confidence score as a progress bar or percentage badge with color coding (green >70%, yellow 50-70%, red <50%). Show risk level with an appropriate badge. Display the reasoning text in a readable paragraph format at the bottom of the card.

Update the recommendation generation logic to trigger in real-time whenever technical data updates. Configure the AI Trade Analysis component to automatically recalculate recommendations when any of the underlying data sources change (new price data, updated indicators, new patterns detected, changed signals). Display a subtle loading indicator when recalculating recommendations. Add a timestamp to show when the recommendation was last generated.

Update the AITradeAnalysisCard component (frontend/src/components/AITradeAnalysisCard.tsx) to prominently display the entry point price at the top of the card, above the take-profit targets. The entry point should include: the price value with appropriate formatting, color coding (green for buy entry, red for sell/short entry based on recommendation direction), a label 'Entry Point', and the entry reasoning text if available. Ensure the entry point section uses clear visual hierarchy with appropriate spacing, icons, and typography to make it immediately visible to users.

Remove all Portfolio feature code and UI from the application. Delete the Portfolio page (frontend/src/pages/Portfolio.tsx), remove Portfolio navigation links from Layout.tsx, delete AddPositionDialog.tsx, PositionCard.tsx, and PortfolioSummary.tsx components, remove the usePortfolio hook (frontend/src/hooks/usePortfolio.ts), and remove all portfolio-related backend functions and state from backend/main.mo (portfolio Map, addPosition, removePosition, getPositions functions). Update the Router configuration in App.tsx to remove the Portfolio route.

Remove all Trading Journal feature code and UI from the application. Delete the Journal page (frontend/src/pages/Journal.tsx), remove Journal navigation links from Layout.tsx, delete AddTradeDialog.tsx, TradeCard.tsx, JournalFilters.tsx, and JournalStats.tsx components, remove the useJournal hook (frontend/src/hooks/useJournal.ts), and remove all journal-related backend functions and state from backend/main.mo (journal Map, addTrade, deleteTrade, getTrades functions). Update the Router configuration in App.tsx to remove the Journal route.

Implement a cyberpunk color scheme with deep black backgrounds and neon accent colors throughout the entire application. Update frontend/src/index.css and frontend/tailwind.config.js to define new CSS custom properties for the cyberpunk theme: near-black background (#0a0a0f or darker), electric blue accent (#00d9ff or #0ff), vibrant purple accent (#b300ff or #c0f), neon green accent (#39ff14 or #0f0), dark card backgrounds (#121218 or similar), and subtle border colors with low opacity. Replace all existing color references in components to use the new cyberpunk palette. Ensure text remains highly readable with appropriate contrast ratios (white/light gray text on dark backgrounds).

Add glowing effects to interactive elements and data cards throughout the application to enhance the cyberpunk aesthetic. Apply CSS box-shadow with neon-colored glows (using the accent colors: electric blue, vibrant purple, neon green) to buttons on hover, active cards, important data points, and interactive chart elements. Use subtle glow effects (low spread, medium blur) for ambient lighting on cards and stronger glows for focus/hover states. Implement glow animations using CSS keyframes for pulsing effects on critical alerts or high-confidence trading signals.

Update typography across the application to use tech-inspired fonts that complement the cyberpunk aesthetic. Configure tailwind.config.js to use a modern, geometric sans-serif font for headings (such as Rajdhani, Orbitron, Exo 2, or Space Grotesk) and a clean monospace font for numerical data, prices, and technical values (such as JetBrains Mono, Fira Code, or Roboto Mono). Ensure fonts are loaded via Google Fonts or similar CDN. Apply appropriate font weights (bold for headings, medium for body, regular for data) and maintain clear typographic hierarchy across all pages and components.

Add smooth CSS transitions and animations to enhance interactivity throughout the application. Implement transitions for hover states (0.2-0.3s duration), page transitions, card appearances, and data updates. Add subtle entrance animations for cards and list items using CSS keyframes or Tailwind animate utilities (fade-in, slide-in effects). Ensure animations feel responsive and modern without causing performance issues or motion sickness (use reduced-motion media queries for accessibility). Apply cyberpunk-style animations like scanline effects, glitch transitions, or data-stream aesthetics where appropriate.

Redesign the CryptoTable component with cyberpunk styling: neon price displays, glowing signal badges, electric accent colors for positive/negative changes, dark table rows with subtle hover glow effects, and tech-inspired borders. Price values should glow in neon green for gains and neon red for losses. Signal badges should have strong neon glow effects. Table headers should use the tech-inspired font with neon underline or border accent. Maintain readability while maximizing visual impact.

Redesign the AITradeAnalysisCard component with cyberpunk aesthetic: glowing recommendation cards, neon-colored entry point display, electric accent borders, pulsing glow effects for high-confidence recommendations, tech-inspired layout with geometric shapes, and vibrant color coding for buy/sell directions. Entry point should have a strong neon glow. Take-profit targets should use gradient badges with neon colors. Confidence score progress bar should glow. Risk level badges should use appropriate neon warning colors.

Redesign the Market Heatmap page with cyberpunk visualization: neon-colored blocks with intense glow effects, electric gradients for price changes (neon green to dark for gains, neon red to dark for losses), glowing borders on hover, pulsing animations for high volatility coins, dark grid background with subtle neon gridlines, and futuristic block styling with geometric shapes. Clicking a block should trigger a neon flash animation before navigation.

Update the Alert History page with cyberpunk styling: dark card backgrounds with neon borders, glowing signal type badges (buy=neon green glow, sell=neon red glow, hold=neon blue glow), tech-inspired timestamp displays with monospace font, electric accent colors for confidence levels, and subtle scanline effects on alert cards. Filter controls should have neon focus states and glowing dropdown menus.

Redesign chart visualizations (CandlestickChart component) with cyberpunk aesthetics: neon-colored candlesticks (green for bullish, red for bearish with glow effects), electric accent lines for support/resistance levels, glowing gridlines, dark chart background with subtle neon gradient overlay, and vibrant color coding for technical indicators. Chart axes should use monospace font with neon color. Hovering over data points should trigger neon glow effects.

Update the Layout component navigation with cyberpunk styling: dark nav background with neon borders, glowing navigation links on hover, electric accent for active route indicator, tech-inspired logo/branding with neon glow, and futuristic mobile menu with slide-in animation and neon backdrop. Theme toggle button should have cyberpunk icon styling with glow effect. Auth button should have prominent neon accent.

Redesign the WatchlistPanel component with cyberpunk styling: dark panel background with neon border accent, glowing crypto icons/logos, neon price displays with pulsing effects for rapid changes, electric color coding for price movements, tech-inspired remove buttons with glow on hover, and futuristic list item styling with geometric separators. Empty state should display cyberpunk-styled message.

Update the MarketSentimentPanel with cyberpunk visualization: glowing sentiment indicators, neon-colored fear/greed index display with animated arc or progress bar, electric accent colors for top gainers (neon green) and losers (neon red), tech-inspired card layouts with geometric shapes, and pulsing glow effects for extreme sentiment values. Overall sentiment badge should have strong neon glow.

Redesign the IndicatorsPanel component with cyberpunk styling: dark indicator cards with neon borders, glowing technical indicator values, electric color coding for overbought/oversold zones (neon red for >70 RSI, neon green for <30 RSI), tech-inspired labels with monospace font, and pulsing glow effects for extreme indicator values. MACD and Bollinger Bands displays should use neon accent colors for visualization.

Update toast notifications with cyberpunk styling: dark toast background with neon border glow, electric accent colors for notification types (info=blue, success=green, warning=yellow, error=red), tech-inspired typography, smooth slide-in animation with neon trail effect, and glowing icons. Notification content should be highly readable with strong contrast.

Enhance mobile responsiveness for the cyberpunk redesign across all components and pages. Ensure neon glow effects remain visible and performant on mobile devices without excessive battery drain. Optimize touch targets for glowing interactive elements (minimum 44x44px). Adapt complex layouts (heatmap, charts, multi-column displays) to mobile screens while preserving cyberpunk aesthetic. Test glow effects, animations, and transitions on mobile browsers to ensure smooth 60fps performance.

Add visual entry point markers directly on the CandlestickChart component. Display green upward arrows or vertical lines for long (buy) entry positions and red downward arrows or vertical lines for short (sell) entry positions. Position the markers at the exact entry price level recommended by the AI trade analysis. Use neon glow effects matching the cyberpunk aesthetic (neon green for long entries with glow shadow, neon red for short entries with glow shadow).

Add three horizontal take-profit level lines on the CandlestickChart component corresponding to the conservative, moderate, and aggressive take-profit targets from the AI trade analysis. Display each level as a horizontal line with a label showing the target type and price. Use gradient neon colors to differentiate the three levels (e.g., dim neon green for conservative, medium intensity neon green for moderate, bright neon green for aggressive). Include subtle glow effects on the lines.

Add a stop-loss level marker on the CandlestickChart component as a horizontal line positioned at the stop-loss price from the AI trade analysis. Use neon red or neon orange color with a warning icon or label. Include a glow effect to make it clearly visible. Position the line below the entry point for long positions or above the entry point for short positions.

Implement pattern explanation tooltips on the CandlestickChart component that appear when hovering over detected candlestick patterns. The tooltip should display the pattern name (e.g., 'Bullish Engulfing', 'Doji', 'Hammer'), a brief description of what the pattern means, and the recommended trading action (e.g., 'Typically signals upward price movement - consider entering long position'). Style tooltips with cyberpunk dark background, neon borders, and clear typography. Position tooltips near the pattern location on the chart without obscuring price data.

Update the CandlestickChart component to integrate with the AI trade recommendation data from the AITradeAnalysisCard component. Ensure the chart receives the entry point price, take-profit targets (conservative/moderate/aggressive), stop-loss price, and trading direction (long/short) as props or through shared state. Synchronize the visual markers with the AI recommendation data so that markers appear/update whenever recommendations are generated or recalculated.

Ensure all chart markers (entry points, take-profit levels, stop-loss) remain visible and readable on mobile devices. Optimize touch interactions for pattern tooltips on mobile (tap to show instead of hover). Scale marker sizes and label fonts appropriately for smaller screens. Test on various mobile screen sizes to ensure markers do not overlap or obscure critical chart data.

Implement staggered request sequencing in the useCryptoPrices hook to reduce initial load API pressure. When fetching cryptocurrency data on dashboard first load, introduce a small delay (100-200ms) between batches of API requests to prevent hitting CoinGecko rate limits all at once. Split the 30 coin requests into 2-3 batches that execute sequentially.

Add client-side response caching to the coingecko.ts service using a Map-based cache with timestamps. Cache successful API responses for 30-45 seconds to prevent redundant calls when components remount or queries refetch. Include cache invalidation logic that respects the 45-second auto-refresh interval already configured in useCryptoPrices.

Implement graceful partial data rendering in the CryptoTable component. When some cryptocurrency data fails to load but others succeed, display the successful data immediately instead of showing a complete error state. Add individual row-level error indicators for coins that failed to load with mini retry buttons.

Add enhanced retry logic specifically for initial page load in the Dashboard component. Implement a more aggressive retry strategy (4-5 attempts instead of 3) with longer backoff delays specifically when isInitialLoading is true in React Query. Display a loading overlay with progress indicator showing retry attempts during initial load.

Improve chart data error handling in the useChartData hook. When OHLC data fails to fetch, implement automatic retry with exponential backoff (similar to useCryptoPrices) and display a user-friendly error message with a prominent retry button in the CandlestickChart component instead of showing blank/empty chart state.

Add a global API health indicator in the Layout component header that monitors CoinGecko API availability. Display a small status badge (green=healthy, yellow=degraded, red=issues) based on recent request success rates. When API issues are detected, show a banner notification explaining that data may be temporarily unavailable with an estimated recovery time.

Optimize React Query configuration in main.tsx to add smarter cache management. Increase staleTime to 30 seconds (from default) and cacheTime to 5 minutes to reduce unnecessary refetches. Add refetchOnWindowFocus: false for crypto price queries to prevent excessive API calls when user switches browser tabs.

Add request deduplication to the coingecko.ts service to prevent multiple identical API calls from executing simultaneously. Use a promise cache that stores in-flight requests by their URL and returns the same promise for duplicate concurrent requests.

new_feature_requests.summary: Real-time price tracking for 20-30 top cryptocurrencies with 30-60 second refresh intervals
Technical indicators: RSI, MACD, Moving Averages, Bollinger Bands
Swing trading signals based on RSI zones, MACD crossovers, and support/resistance breaks
Customizable watchlist for cryptocurrencies
Multi-timeframe chart analysis (1H, 4H, Daily)
Candlestick pattern recognition
Support/resistance level detection
Market sentiment dashboard
Dark/light mode with mobile-responsive layout
Internet Identity authentication
CoinGecko API integration for real-time crypto prices
Trade alerts triggered by swing trading signals (RSI zones, MACD crossovers, support/resistance breaks) with in-app notifications and alert history page
Market heatmap page with block size by market cap, color intensity by 24h price change, toggleable layers (volume spikes, volatility, BTC correlation, RSI levels)
Volume analysis highlighting unusual volume spikes
Fibonacci retracement overlays on charts
Mobile-first responsive design improvements

Store triggered trading alerts in Motoko backend with fields: timestamp, cryptocurrency ID/symbol, signal type (buy/sell/hold), trigger reason (RSI zone, MACD crossover, support/resistance break), confidence level, and price at trigger. Implement backend functions to add new alerts, fetch alert history for a user (with optional filters by crypto or date range), and optionally purge old alerts (e.g., older than 30 days). Associate alerts with user principals from Internet Identity.

Implement toggleable overlay layers for the Market Heatmap that modify the visual display: 1) Volume Change layer - highlight cryptocurrencies with unusual volume spikes (e.g., >2x average volume) with distinct visual indicator (border, icon, or overlay pattern), 2) Volatility layer - show which coins have highest price volatility independent of direction using color intensity or pattern, 3) BTC Correlation layer - display how closely each altcoin follows Bitcoin's price movements using visual indicators (high correlation vs low correlation), 4) RSI Levels layer - overlay RSI status with color coding (green for oversold <30, red for overbought >70, neutral for mid-range). Provide toggle buttons/checkboxes above the heatmap to enable/disable each layer independently.

Calculate and display volume analysis data showing unusual volume spikes for tracked cryptocurrencies. Compare current 24h volume against average volume over the past 7-30 days. Flag cryptocurrencies where current volume is significantly higher (e.g., >2x or >3x average) as having unusual volume activity. Display this information in the heatmap volume layer and optionally as a dedicated section in the market sentiment dashboard or crypto detail pages.

Add Fibonacci retracement level overlays to the candlestick charts on crypto detail pages. Automatically calculate and draw Fibonacci retracement levels (0%, 23.6%, 38.2%, 50%, 61.8%, 100%) based on the most recent significant price swing (high to low for downtrends, low to high for uptrends) within the visible timeframe. Display levels as horizontal lines with labels showing percentage and price. Provide a toggle to show/hide Fibonacci levels on the chart.
Add user-friendly retry buttons with exponential backoff and request batching to handle API failures gracefully
Add timeframe selector (1H, 4H, Daily) on main dashboard page to control chart displays across watchlist

AI-powered trade recommendation system on coin detail pages that analyzes all technical indicators (signals, support/resistance, patterns, RSI, MACD, MA, BB) to generate entry points, multiple take-profit targets (conservative/moderate/aggressive), stop-loss suggestions, confidence scores, risk levels, and reasoning in real-time

Redesign UI with cyberpunk aesthetic: deep black backgrounds, neon accent colors (electric blue, vibrant purple, neon green), glowing effects on cards and interactive elements, tech-inspired typography, smooth animations, and cyberpunk-style data visualization across all pages

Add visual trading markers directly on candlestick charts: entry point markers (green arrows/lines for long, red for short), take-profit level lines (3 targets: conservative/moderate/aggressive), stop-loss level markers, and pattern explanation tooltips on hover
